intro: Epilobium gansuense, commonly known as the Gansu willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually arranged in dense inflorescences. Epilobium gansuense is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
